alert.note: Alert for Phillips; Valley (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 16 at 2:30PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: .Snow melt and continued runoff will lead to increased river and stream levels, as well as minor flooding of low spots, through the next several days. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Montana, including the following counties, Phillips and Valley. * WHEN...Until noon MDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 227 PM MDT, satellite estimates indicate snowmelt and swollen rivers/streams in the advisory area. This will cause minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Glasgow, Malta, Opheim, Whitewater, Nashua, Saco, Dodson, Hinsdale, Tampico, St. Marie, Port Of Opheim, Loring, Port Of Morgan, Frazer, Lustre, Frenchman Reservoir, Vandalia, Thoeny, Sleeping Buffalo and Bowdoin. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
